videos.title: GAËLLE ON TOUR: THE CARPATHIAN TRAVERSE.
videos.description:
“What to say about Gaëlle that isn't all superlatives... I could list all that I know and I still don't think they capture the spirit and determination of someone like her. I first heard of this young French woman touring on her own in the winter, in the cold and snowy mountains to the east of Europe when I was also living a nomadic bike life but in the dry, south of the Iberian peninsula. I felt a little humbled by seeing such strength of character of someone at such an age, as when I was younger it was mostly parties and late nights for me. The pictures and stories that she shares from her adventures tell a great deal about what it's like to tour on a bike throughout the year, and the small insight she grants us into her experiences are things to be enjoyed again and again. Chapeau Gaëlle, bon courage!” ( Andy Cox, founder of https://www.instagram.com/europeandividetrail)

In 2019 Gaëlle and her ARISE TOUR bike headed out for an staggering loop around Europe, covering all it's countries within. From the heat of southern Spain to the frozen coast of Scandinavia, while traversing the Carpathians somewhere in the middle, home to brown bears and wolves. Crossing the Carpathian and following its mountain curve from south to north this area also holds a little insight for her personally, as this is where her grandad hales from, it is also about the Carpathian’s rough roads and – rain, loads of rain. From what we know of her last movies about Turkey and Great Britain we are already excited about another episode and her skilled eye to put situations in scene as to let pictures talk emotionally.

Cycled, filmed & produced by Gaëlle Bojko. 

https://www.instagram.com/biketotheblocks/
https://www.facebook.com/biketotheblocks/
https://bombtrack.com/family/gaelle/ 

Soundtrack used with friendly permission:

Dead Man’s Eyes “This Old Place” & “Two Dozen Eyes”. Dead Mans Eye’s appears courtesy of Tonzonen Records. “This Old Place” & “Two Dozen Eyes” are taken from their longplayer “Words Of Prey” (2018). For more great music and information visit https://deadmanseyes.bandcamp.com/ 

Deaf Radio „Gas Station People”. Deaf Radio appears courtesy of copyright control. “Gas Station People“ is taken from their longplayer “Modern Panic” (2019). For more great music and information visit https://deafradio.bandcamp.com/ 

Pete Josef “Move On”. Pete Josef appears courtesy of Sonar Kollektiv. “Move On” is taken from his longplayer “Colour” (2015). For more great music and information visit https://petejosef.bandcamp.com/ 

Christian Löffler “Veiled Grey”. Christian Löffler appears courtesy of Ki Records. “Veiled Grey“ is taken from his longplayer “Young Alaska” (2014).  For more great music and information visit https://www.christian-loeffler.net/

videos.title: GAËLLE ON TOUR: THE CARPATHIAN TRAVERSE. [official trailer]
videos.description:
In 2019 Gaëlle and her ARISE TOUR bike headed out for an staggering loop around Europe, covering all it's countries within. From the heat of southern Spain to the frozen coast of Scandinavia, while traversing the Carpathians somewhere in the middle - home to brown bears and wolves. From what we know of her last movies about Turkey and Great Britain we can already say her journey was far from 'average.' We’re more than excited to see what she’ll come up with later this month!

videos.description:

@BassoBikes_HQ

videos.title: GRAVEL SOCIETY IN ''ORIENTAL CARPATHIANS BY BIKE''
videos.description: For new cyclists, riding gravel and solitary dirt roads is a natural solution to the problems of road riding or mountain biking. Traffic on paved roads scares many new cyclists, and the absence of a safe shoulder or the threatening presence of a gutter strewn with broken glass and debris can be paralyzing. The technical skills required for mountain biking are also an impediment for many. Riding gravel and dirt roads, on the other hand, offers a quiet cycling experience with only a minimal amount of cycling prowess required.

videos.title: Cycling Through The Carpathian Mountains In Ukraine!
videos.description:
If you want to support the tour, you can donate here: https://www.patreon.com/TravelingTice

Woke up on top of Mount. Ostra in Ukraine. Cycling through foggy Carpathian Mountains in Ukraine. First part was very hilly but after I passed a military checkpoint the road became worse but it was only downhill. I made it to a place called Uzhhorod where I booked a hostel for 4 euros a night.

Filmed on July 19, 2018
TravelingTice Vlog Nr. 118

For more info, go to my website: https://travelingtice.com

Links to my gear:

Dell XPS 15 laptop: https://amzn.to/2J5GEIB
IconnTechs IT 4k Action Cam (newer model): http://amzn.to/2HIvzcB
IconnTechs It 4k Action Cam (older model): http://amzn.to/2BNQxX2
DSLR Camera: http://amzn.to/2HIl2hJ
Very Good Lens for the Camera: http://amzn.to/2Fsu9SW
Wide angle lens: http://amzn.to/2CH4GSE
50mm Lens for Low Light: http://amzn.to/2CHNw7v
Compact Camera: http://amzn.to/2ES2qy4
Big tripod: http://amzn.to/2GI1LM5
Small tripod: http://amzn.to/2EOPUPN
Monopod: http://amzn.to/2ETM5VG
Voice recorder: http://amzn.to/2GJluer
Allpowers Solar Panel (10W): https://tinyurl.com/ychmlrpn
Tent I Use: https://amzn.to/2tMdkha
Awesome Soap I Use: https://amzn.to/2IQpcUg
DOG DEFENSE DEVICE: https://amzn.to/2IRRehX

Thank you so much for watching!

Please like and subscribe if you haven't already for more adventures! :D

Subscribe Here: https://tinyurl.com/y9qggv3q

Follow TravelingTice on social media:

Instagram: @travelingtice https://www.instagram.com/travelingtice
